brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigates the effect of eye opening/closure on the quality of IOP (intraocular
      pressure) related patterns recorded with SENSIMED Triggerfish. Each subject receives 2
      24-hour recording sessions, one with the recorded eye open and the other with the eye
      closed,using an ophthalmic patch.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy subject without previous ophthalmic medical history (except from indication
             for glasses)

          -  Aged ≥18 years, of either sex

          -  Have given written informed consent, prior to any investigational procedures

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with allergy to corneal anesthetic

          -  Patients with contraindications for silicone contact lens wear

          -  Patients not able to understand the character and individual consequences of the
             investigation

          -  Participation in other clinical research within the last 4 weeks

facility.name: HUG, Department of Ophthalmology, Glaucoma Sector

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Open Label Study to Assess the 24-hour Intraocular Pressure Pattern Recorded With SENSIMED Triggerfish® in Healthy Subjects With Closed Eye

primary_outcome.description: TF will be installed on subjects' eyes for 24 hours in two sessions. In one session the eye will remain open (except during sleep) while in the other session the eye will be closed using an ophthalmic patch throughout the 24 hours. For both sessions, the initial TF output value in millivolt equivalent will be subtracted from the final output value to yield the difference from start to end. The difference obtained in the session with closed eye will be divided by that of the session with open eye (ratio).
primary_outcome.measure: The difference between start and end TF (SENSIMED Triggerfish) in a closed eye as compared to the difference between start to end TF in an open eye

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
